intro: Melolobium, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plants typically have compound leaves and produce small, pod-like fruits. Melolobium species are often found in a variety of habitats, including woodlands and grasslands. They play an important role in soil enrichment due to their nitrogen-fixing ability.
